This subtlety points to the problem involved in speaking of language, agreed by all to be a convention, as a product of nature. What, then, is Erasmusโs concept of the role of metaphor in speech that is natural? We can see that unlike the Stoics, Erasmus does not reject metaphor, yet his definition in De Copia and critique of Bude rest on a clear understanding of metaphor as a transgression of a direct wordโto- thing correspondence. Like all writers, he must confront the question of what level of disruption is tolerable.
